page.title: 06Up Bradley Church Tower
page.content: On Thursday.July 13th,we went up the tower.The Vicar ,our teacher and Mr Holt,a church warden,came with us.The tower is 16th century on a 13th base. The doorway in the west wall was blocked using Norman stonework.We climbed the 59 steps up the spiral stone staircase to the top.It was very dark.Halfway up Mr Holt showed us how to wind the clock up.We went on up to the belfry and were shown the five old bells.Mr Holt made one of them ring.The belfry was used as a look out post during the last war.At the top of the 75ft tower we could see our modern Domesday area.We took two photographs. Mr Nutter from BBC Stoke came with us and asked us about our church.On Tuesday,July 16th,we listened to the radio and heard ourselves talking about the Domesday project.
